Package net.proteusframework.ui.search Description

Classes for modeling search criteria, results, and UI needs.

The API provided here is built around QLBuilder. The purpose of QLBuilder is to allow independent code to help build queries for HQL / SQL. This is also structured to be independent of UI concerns. The loose coupling allows us to easily provide persistence of queries, reusable criteria/constraint implementations, reusable constraint UIs that are independent of the criteria, and reusable search UIs. These classes are building blocks for programmatic creation of queries and UIs for creating queries.

Most uses of this API starts with SearchUI. To create an SearchUI for querying data, you generally assemble it in the following order.
  • Create a SearchModelImpl.
    • Populate the search model with ...
    • ISearchConstraints.
    • ISearchResultColumns.
  • Create a SearchSupplierImpl and set the search model on it.
  • Create an Options object.
    • Configure the options ...
    • Set the search supplier created earlier.
    • If you need an "Add Entity" type of action, set the entityActions property.
    • If you have fixed constraints such as only allowing managers to see certain data, then set the fixedConstraints property.
    • Explore and try out other options.
  • Create a SearchUIImpl with the options created earlier.
  • Add the SearchUI to an MIWT Component or use with a SearchUIApp.
